name: Poverty's Grip
title: Highest Multidimensional Poverty Rate
description: In 2019, 84.2% of Chad's population lived in multidimensional poverty, the highest rate globally. This highlights significant challenges in health, education, and living standards.

name: Maternal Health Crisis
title: Highest Maternal Mortality Ratio
description: Chad recorded a maternal mortality ratio of 1389 per 100,000 live births in 2015, the highest globally, indicating severe healthcare challenges for mothers.

name: Childhood Labor Norm
title: High Child Employment Rates
description: In 2015, 55.9% of children aged 7-14 in Chad were employed, with 55.1% of females and 56.7% of males working, reflecting economic pressures on families.

name: Teenage Motherhood Prevalence
title: High Teenage Motherhood Rate
description: In 2015, 35.9% of women aged 15-19 in Chad had children or were pregnant, highlighting early childbearing as a prevalent issue.

name: Rural Expansion
title: Rapid Rural Population Growth
description: Chad experienced a 4.17% annual growth in its rural population in 2023, indicating a significant shift towards rural living.

name: Traditional Fertility Norms
title: High Wanted Fertility Rate
description: In 2015, the wanted fertility rate in Chad was 6.1 births per woman, reflecting cultural preferences for larger families.

name: Gender Norms Challenge
title: High Acceptance of Domestic Violence
description: In 2015, 48.6% of women in Chad believed a husband is justified in beating his wife if she burns the food, highlighting deep-rooted gender norms.

name: Power Outage Nation
title: Limited Access to Electricity
description: In 2023, only 40% of Chad's rural population had access to electricity, with an electric power consumption of just 14.47 kWh per capita in 2022.

name: Literacy Lows
title: Struggles in Education
description: As of 2022, Chad's youth literacy rate was 36.07%, with adult female literacy at a mere 18.87%.

name: Health Hurdles
title: High Maternal Mortality Risk
description: In 2023, the lifetime risk of maternal death in Chad was 1 in 24, highlighting significant health challenges.

name: Trade Troubles
title: Challenges in International Trade
description: Chad scored 12.10 in the quality of public services for international trade facilitation in 2024, indicating room for improvement.

name: Corruption Concerns
title: Low Control of Corruption
description: In 2022, Chad ranked in the 47th percentile for control of corruption, suggesting governance issues.

name: Broadband Blues
title: Limited Internet Access
description: In 2019, Chad had only 68 fixed broadband subscriptions, equating to 0.0004 per 100 people.

name: Youthful Workforce
title: High Child Labor Hours
description: In 2015, children aged 7-14 in Chad worked an average of 8.83 hours per week, with boys working up to 13.05 hours.

name: Tourism Tumble
title: Low International Tourism
description: In 2020, only 5,500 international departures were recorded, indicating a limited tourism industry.

name: Sanitation Struggles
title: Limited Rural Sanitation Access
description: In 2022, only 4.51% of Chad's rural population had access to basic sanitation services.

name: Education Gender Gap
title: Low Female Educational Attainment
description: By 2019, only 3.71% of females aged 25+ had completed lower secondary education in Chad.
